sub_tasks.requirements: Gender Selection: The query must filter the patient cohort to include only females (e.g., p.gender = 'F').
Age Range Selection: The query must restrict the patient cohort to the age range of 77-87 years (e.g., p.anchor_age BETWEEN 77 AND 87).
Medical Concept Implementation for Heart Failure and COPD
Heart Failure Identification: Correctly identifies heart failure using both ICD-9 ('428%') and ICD-10 ('I50%') codes within the diagnoses_icd table.
COPD Identification: Correctly identifies COPD using both ICD-9 (SUBSTR(icd_code, 1, 3) BETWEEN '491' AND '496') and ICD-10 ('J44%') codes.
Dual Condition Filtering: Ensures that each hospital admission (hadm_id) has at least one diagnosis for heart failure AND at least one for COPD using a HAVING clause with SUM logic.
Patient-Admission Join: Correctly joins the 'patients' and 'admissions' tables on 'subject_id' to link patient demographics with admission details.
Admission-Condition Join: Correctly joins the 'admissions' table with the pre-filtered CTE ('hadm_with_conditions') on 'hadm_id' to restrict the cohort to relevant admissions.
Length of Stay Calculation: Correctly calculates the length of stay in days by finding the difference between 'dischtime' and 'admittime' (e.g., DATE_DIFF(DATE(a.dischtime), DATE(a.admittime), DAY)).
Data Validity Check: Filters out admissions with null admission/discharge times or non-positive length of stay to ensure data quality.
Standard Deviation Aggregation: Uses the STDDEV_SAMP function to compute the sample standard deviation of the length of stay.
Output Formatting: Rounds the final standard deviation value to two decimal places using the ROUND function.
